==Events==
*[[1180]] &ndash; [[Manuel I Komnenos]], last Emperor of the Komnenian restoration dies. The [[Byzantine Empire]] slips into terminal decline.
*[[1645]] &ndash; [[Battle of Rowton Heath]], [[Roundhead|Parliamentarian]] victory over a [[Cavalier|Royalist]] army commanded in person by [[Charles I of England|King Charles]]
*[[1664]] &ndash; The [[Dutch Republic]] surrenders [[New Amsterdam]] to [[England]].
*[[1674]] &ndash; Second Tantrik Coronation of [[Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj]].
*[[1780]] &ndash; [[Benedict Arnold]] flees to [[British Army]] lines when the arrest of British Major [[John André]] exposes Arnold's plot to surrender [[West Point]].
*[[1789]] &ndash; The [[United States Congress]] passes the [[Judiciary Act of 1789|Judiciary Act]] which creates the office of the [[United States Attorney General]] and the federal judiciary system, and orders the composition of the [[Supreme Court of the United States]].
*[[1830]] &ndash; [[Belgian Revolution]]: A revolutionary committee of notables forms the [[Provisional Government of Belgium]].
*[[1841]] &ndash; The [[Sultan of Brunei|Sultan]] of [[Brunei]] cedes [[Sarawak]] to the [[United Kingdom]].
*[[1846]] &ndash; [[Mexican–American War]]: General [[Zachary Taylor]] captures [[Monterrey]]. 
*[[1852]] &ndash; The first [[airship]] powered by (a steam) engine, created by [[Henri Giffard]], travels {{convert|17|mi|km}} from [[Paris]] to [[Trappes]].
*[[1853]] &ndash; Admiral [[Auguste Febvrier Despointes|Despointes]] formally takes possession of [[New Caledonia]] in the name of [[France]]. 
*[[1869]] &ndash; "[[Black Friday (1869)|Black Friday]]": [[Gold]] prices plummet after [[Ulysses S. Grant]] orders the [[United States Department of the Treasury|Treasury]] to sell large quantities of gold after [[Jay Gould]] and [[James Fisk (financier)|James Fisk]] plot to control the market.
*[[1877]] &ndash; [[Battle of Shiroyama]], decisive victory of the [[Imperial Japanese Army]] over the [[Satsuma Rebellion]]
*[[1890]] &ndash; [[The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints]] officially [[1890 Manifesto|renounces]] [[Mormonism and polygamy|polygamy]].
*[[1906]] &ndash; [[U.S. President]] [[Theodore Roosevelt]] proclaims [[Devils Tower National Monument|Devils Tower]] in [[Wyoming]] as the nation's first [[U.S. National Monument|National Monument]].
*[[1911]] &ndash; [[HMA No. 1|His Majesty's Airship No. 1]], Britain's first [[rigid airship]], is wrecked by strong winds before her maiden flight at [[Barrow-in-Furness]].
*[[1914]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: The [[Siege of Przemyśl]] (present-day Poland) begins.
*[[1932]] &ndash; [[Mohandas K. Gandhi|Gandhi]] and Dr. [[B. R. Ambedkar]] agree to the [[Poona Pact]], which reserved seats in the Indian provincial legislatures for the "[[Dalits|Depressed Classes]]" (Untouchables).
*[[1935]] &ndash; [[Earl W. Bascom|Earl Bascom]] and Weldon Bascom produce the first [[rodeo]] ever held outdoors under electric lights at [[Columbia, Mississippi]]
*[[1946]] &ndash; [[Cathay Pacific Airways]] is founded in [[Hong Kong]].
*  1946   &ndash; [[Clark Clifford]] and [[George Elsey]], military advisers to U.S. President [[Harry S. Truman]], present him with a top-secret report on the Soviet Union that first recommends the [[containment]] policy.
*[[1948]] &ndash; The [[Honda|Honda Motor Company]] is founded.
*[[1950]] &ndash; Forest fires black out the sun over portions of [[Canada]] and [[New England]]. A [[Blue moon#Visibly blue moon|blue moon]] is seen as far away as [[Europe]].
*[[1957]] &ndash; [[Camp Nou]], the largest [[List of European stadia by capacity|stadium in Europe]], is opened in [[Barcelona]].
*  1957   &ndash; President [[Dwight D. Eisenhower]] sends [[101st Airborne Division]] troops to [[Little Rock, Arkansas]], to enforce [[Little Rock Nine|desegregation]].
*[[1960]] &ndash; {{USS|Enterprise|CVN-65}}, the world's first nuclear-powered [[aircraft carrier]], is launched.
*[[1962]] &ndash; [[United States court of appeals]] orders the [[University of Mississippi]] to admit [[James Meredith]].
*[[1968]] &ndash; ''[[60 Minutes]]'' debuts on [[CBS]].
*  1968   &ndash; [[Swaziland]] joins the [[United Nations]].
*[[1973]] &ndash; [[Guinea-Bissau]] declares its independence from [[Portugal]].
*[[1979]] &ndash; [[CompuServe]] launches the first consumer internet service, which features the first public [[electronic mail]] service.
*[[1990]] &ndash; Periodic [[Great White Spot]] is observed on [[Saturn]].
*[[1996]] &ndash; Representatives of 71 nations sign the [[Comprehensive Nuclear-Test-Ban Treaty]] at the [[United Nations]].
*[[2005]] &ndash; [[Hurricane Rita]] makes landfall in the [[United States]], devastating [[Beaumont, Texas]] and portions of southwestern [[Louisiana]].
*[[2007]] &ndash; Between 30,000 and 100,000 people take part in [[2007 Burmese anti-government protests|anti-government protests]] in [[Yangon]], Burma, the largest in 20 years.
*[[2009]] &ndash; The [[2009 G-20 Pittsburgh summit|G20 summit]] begins in [[Pittsburgh]] with 30 global leaders in attendance.  It marks the first use of [[LRAD]] in U.S. history.
*[[2013]] &ndash; A [[Moment magnitude scale|7.7-magnitude]] [[2013 Pakistan earthquake|earthquake strikes]] southern [[Pakistan]], killing more than 327 people.
